TITLE: Biden administration forgives $37 million in student debt for defrauded borrowers
SUMMARY: The Biden administration announced it would cancel nearly $37 million in student debt for over 1,200 students who attended the University of Phoenix.

TITLE: The Federal Reserve leaves rates unchanged. Here's how it impacts your money
SUMMARY: At the end of its two-day meeting Wednesday, the Fed said it would skip a rate hike in September. But it won't get any less expensive to borrow.

TITLE: A 'financial vortex' of competing priorities may reduce retirement savings by up to 37%, Goldman Sachs finds
SUMMARY: Unexpected life events may put a dent in your retirement savings. But top advisors say consistently living below your means may help adjust for those surprises.

TITLE: TikTok interviewers ask ‘How much do you make?’ What you can learn from the answers
SUMMARY: In viral social media clips, creators ask someone they encounter on the street about their position and salary. The answers can help promote pay transparency.

TITLE: IRS will 'substantially' reduce audits on low-income tax credit, commissioner says
SUMMARY: The IRS said it will "substantially" reduce the number of correspondence audits for filers claiming the earned income tax credit.

TITLE: This account is like an ‘extra strength’ Roth IRA, advisor says. Here's when to use it
SUMMARY: A health savings account offers unique tax benefits and lets savers repay themselves later. Here's how and when to use an HSA, advisors say.

TITLE: Student loan payments are about to restart. What you need to know ahead of receiving that first bill
SUMMARY: The pandemic-era relief policy that has lasted 42 months will finally conclude in October.

TITLE: As federal student loan payments restart, some older borrowers' Social Security benefits may be at risk
SUMMARY: Older federal student loan debtors who fall behind on payments may be at risk of having their Social Security checks garnished.

TITLE: Here are 3 money moves wealthy Americans are more likely to make in times of economic uncertainty
SUMMARY: There are certain money moves wealthy Americans are more likely to make to improve their long-term well-being.

TITLE: Op-ed: Think you know gray divorce? You have no idea
SUMMARY: While every divorcing couple has legal and logistical issues to weigh, for those divorcing later in life, in a "gray" divorce, there are even more questions.

TITLE: Navigating medical bills: Take these 12 steps to manage costs and minimize debt
SUMMARY: Unexpected medical bills can be expensive. Sometimes, they're unavoidable. But you may avoid paying more than you have to by asking the right questions.

TITLE: Here's what tax pros recommend after the IRS halts processing for small business tax credit
SUMMARY: As the IRS pauses on processing new employee retention tax credit claims, some filers are in limbo as the agency works on further guidance. Here's what to know.

TITLE: Pay secrecy norms have ‘simply lost their teeth,’ say experts. Here's why
SUMMARY: New York is the latest state to adopt a law around pay transparency in job postings.

TITLE: The wage gap costs women $1.6 trillion a year, new report finds. Here's how to get the pay you deserve
SUMMARY: Women earned 78 cents for every dollar a white, non-Hispanic man made in 2022, researchers found. Experts urge women to use the data as fuel for fair pay.

TITLE: The Federal Reserve may not hike interest rates this week. What that means for you
SUMMARY: After raising interest rates 11 times since March 2022, the Fed is poised to take a break. Here's what that means for your wallet.

TITLE: Why health insurance is poised to make inflation jump
SUMMARY: The health insurance inflation index has fallen each month since October. That trend is set to reverse, economists said.

TITLE: 3 financial tips for couples moving in together for the first time
SUMMARY: When couples move in together for the first time, many financial questions and tasks arise, leaving room for disagreement and awkwardness.

TITLE: Withheld transcripts, kicked off campus: College payment plans pose risks, consumer watchdog warns
SUMMARY: Unable to come up with the cash for steep college tuition bills all at once, many families decide to pay the tab over time. That option comes with risks.

TITLE: Recession vs. soft landing is a 'million-dollar question,' expert says. Where top financial advisors say to invest now
SUMMARY: Though a downturn may still be on the horizon, top financial advisors see opportunities in equities, fixed income and cash now.

TITLE: Here are 3 things to consider before making a Roth conversion to save on future taxes
SUMMARY: If you're weighing a Roth individual retirement account conversion to save on future taxes, here are three things to consider first, financial advisors say.

TITLE: Student loan borrowers at risk of scams as payments restart, says FTC
SUMMARY: The Federal Trade Commission warned that scammers may call and text federal student loan borrowers with offers to "help" as payments restart in October.

TITLE: The biggest downside to 529 plans is about to go away. Now they’re a ‘no-brainer,’ expert says
SUMMARY: Starting in 2024, savers can roll unused money from a 529 plan over to Roth individual retirement account free of income tax or tax penalties.

TITLE: Op-ed: Women, let's talk about money
SUMMARY: When we create spaces for women to talk about money, understand our "money roots" and our inherited money stories, it facilitates financial breakthroughs.

TITLE: Women are likely to face financial curveballs in retirement — including one potentially life-destroying event
SUMMARY: Certain financial shocks may hurt women's financial preparedness before and during retirement. Experts say those risks can be mitigated with proper planning.

TITLE: IRS halts processing of a small business tax break amid 'surge of questionable claims'
SUMMARY: The IRS will immediately stop processing new claims for the employee retention credit to protect filers from a "surge of questionable claims."

TITLE: Your 401(k) could have these hidden risks, experts say. Here’s what employees need to know
SUMMARY: While many investors focus on stock market volatility, there could be other 401(k) risks, especially when there's a company bankruptcy. Here's what to know.

TITLE: 47% of Americans say achieving retirement security will take a miracle. Why inflation is to blame
SUMMARY: Many Americans expect to have to make some tough choices in retirement, a new survey from Natixis finds. Record high inflation is to blame.

TITLE: Some federal student loan holders may be able to tap into 529 plans for help when payments restart
SUMMARY: A fairly recent change to 529 plans that allows limited withdrawals for student debt may be especially appealing with the payments soon scheduled to restart.

TITLE: Average Social Security retirement benefit may grow by some $57 per month in 2024, new estimate finds
SUMMARY: New government inflation data points to a 3.2% Social Security cost-of-living adjustment in 2024. Here's how that estimate may affect you.

TITLE: Here's the inflation breakdown for August 2023, in one chart
SUMMARY: A spike in gasoline prices was largely responsible for a 3.7% annual increase in the consumer price index for August 2023.
